alert.note: Alert for Gregg; Harrison; Panola; Rusk; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Webster, northern De Soto, northern Red River, Caddo, northwestern Jackson, southern Claiborne, Bienville, southern Bossier and western Lincoln Parishes, central Rusk, northwestern Shelby, southern Harrison, Panola and southern Gregg Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1044 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kilgore to 8 miles east of Homer. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Longview, Bossier City, Marshall, Henderson, Minden, Kilgore, Carthage, Mansfield, Grambling, Jonesboro, Homer, Hallsville, Haughton, Greenwood, Arcadia, Blanchard, Waskom, Benton and Stonewall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana...and eastern and northeastern Texas.
